pr_title: MULE-18294: Polling source schedulers must not restart on reconnections

timeline.bodyText: don't use maps. Build a explicit pojo.
timeline.author: marianogonzalez

replies.bodyText: In the end I would need to use a POJO with at least a field that is a map, right? What is stored in the context is specific to the restarting of a polling source.
replies.author: ndinu

replies.bodyText: why? right now you're using a map on which you only put two entries with well known keys. Just use a pojo with two well known fields... If in the future you need a map, you add a map, but I don't see why you would need that and you certainly don't need it now
replies.author: marianogonzalez

replies.bodyText: My point is, the Restartable interface needs to be generic, not everything that can be restarted needs a Runnable and a Scheduler. Does it make sense?
replies.author: ndinu

replies.bodyText: but this is internal. We can change it as much as we want.. Rename it to RestartableSource if you want
replies.author: marianogonzalez

timeline.bodyText: I don't understand the point of this... if this guy is reconnecting is because it failed while executing. That means that you first simply poll() and then simply  scheduler.schedule(executor, () -> poll(sourceCallback));... everything else you added seems unnecessary. What am I missing?
timeline.author: marianogonzalez
marianogonzalez
marianogonzalez

timeline.bodyText: although I insist this is not necesary, this isn't a bad idea as the delegate you're keeping from the prior instance is quite likely to have references to the old instance...potentially producing leaks
timeline.author: marianogonzalez

timeline.bodyText: rename to getRestartContext and turn that map into an actual SourceRestartContext class
timeline.author: marianogonzalez
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,35 @@
+/*
+ * Copyright (c) MuleSoft, Inc.  All rights reserved.  http://www.mulesoft.com
+ * The software in this package is published under the terms of the CPAL v1.0
+ * license, a copy of which has been included with this distribution in the
+ * LICENSE.txt file.
+ */
+package org.mule.runtime.module.extension.internal.runtime.source.poll;
+
+import java.util.Map;
+
+/**
+ * A component that can be restarted.
+ *
+ * When restarted {@link #beginRestart()} needs to be called and will return a {@link Map}. After the restart is
+ * performed, the {@link #finishRestart(Map)} will be called with the value that the {@link #beginRestart()} method
+ * have generated.
+ *
+ * @since 4.2.3 4.3.1 4.4.0
+ */
+public interface Restartable {
+
+  /**
+   * Method that needs to be called when a restart is performed.
+   *
+   * @return a context needed after a restart is performed.
+   */
+  Map<String, Object> beginRestart();

timeline.author: marianogonzalez
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,35 @@
+/*
+ * Copyright (c) MuleSoft, Inc.  All rights reserved.  http://www.mulesoft.com
+ * The software in this package is published under the terms of the CPAL v1.0
+ * license, a copy of which has been included with this distribution in the
+ * LICENSE.txt file.
+ */
+package org.mule.runtime.module.extension.internal.runtime.source.poll;
+
+import java.util.Map;
+
+/**
+ * A component that can be restarted.
+ *
+ * When restarted {@link #beginRestart()} needs to be called and will return a {@link Map}. After the restart is
+ * performed, the {@link #finishRestart(Map)} will be called with the value that the {@link #beginRestart()} method
+ * have generated.
+ *
+ * @since 4.2.3 4.3.1 4.4.0
+ */
+public interface Restartable {
+
+  /**
+   * Method that needs to be called when a restart is performed.
+   *
+   * @return a context needed after a restart is performed.
+   */
+  Map<String, Object> beginRestart();
+
+  /**
+   * Method that needs to be called to finish the process of restarting.
+   *
+   * @param restartingContext the context generated by {@link #beginRestart()}
+   */
+  void finishRestart(Map<String, Object> restartingContext);

timeline.bodyText: I get what you mean, but the term rescheduled is quite misleading
timeline.author: marianogonzalez
marianogonzalez

replies.bodyText: this comment is unsufficient. The main reason for this was to make sure that the delegate is not invoked if the scheduler fires while the restart is in progress
replies.author: marianogonzalez

timeline.bodyText: a get method should never have side effects
timeline.author: marianogonzalez

replies.bodyText: The source need to know that a restart is coming so that it does not kill the scheduler. Maybe we should change the name of the method?
replies.author: ndinu

replies.bodyText: you can change the mehthod name, but still, is this the right place for doing this?
replies.author: marianogonzalez

timeline.author: marianogonzalez

replies.bodyText: At this point the delegate is null, I can set it to null here instead of in the getRestartContext method, but I cannot set the delegate here since the poll method needs the SourceCallbackContext which is not available yet, we get it in the doStart method.
replies.author: ndinu

replies.bodyText: then it is clear that this should happen in the doStart() method instead of here.........
replies.author: marianogonzalez

timeline.bodyText: This test is yielding false positives. The test pases because the number of invokations you want is correct, but you're not seeing that the instance that is actually modifying this is not the one you wanted. Change this by a Map<Source, Integer> and also assert which instances had how many invokations
timeline.author: marianogonzalez

timeline.bodyText: this should happen on the restart method, not here
timeline.author: marianogonzalez
marianogonzalez
